item.name: Dataspace
OEM (Data Providing Agent)
Provisioning/Binding Agent

body.raw:
PREFIX cx: <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/cx.ttl#>
PREFIX cx-diag: <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/diagnosis.ttl#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
SELECT ?reason ?code ?description ?version ?partend ?partcat ?partclass WHERE {
  # Select Business Partner
  ?Oem cx:BPNL "BPNL00000003COJN".

  # Search for Trouble Codes of the Business Partner
  # related to a cause in the "Kabelbaum"
  ?Dtc rdf:type cx-diag:DTC.
  ?Dtc cx:provisionedBy ?Oem.
  ?Dtc cx-diag:PossibleCauses ?reason.
  FILTER contains(?reason,"Kabelbaum").
  ?Dtc cx-diag:Code ?code.
  ?Dtc cx-diag:Description ?description.
  ?Dtc cx-diag:Version ?version.

  # Navigate to the affected parts
  # and show only parts with a classification "Powertrain"
  ?Dtc cx-diag:affects ?Part.
  ?Part cx-diag:Category ?partcat.
  ?Part cx-diag:EnDenomination ?partend.
  ?Part cx-diag:Classification ?partclass.
  FILTER contains(?partclass,'Powertrain').

} LIMIT 40
SELECT ?part WHERE { ?part <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#type> <https://raw.githubusercontent.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/main/ontology/cx_ontology.ttl#Part> . }

body.raw:
{
    "@context": {
        "rdf": "http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#",
        "rdfs": "http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#",
        "cx-common": "https://w3id.org/catenax/ontology/common#",
        "sh": "http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#"
    },
    "asset": {
        "@type": "Asset",
        "@id": "GraphAsset?oem=Diagnosis2022", 
        "properties": {
            "name": "Diagnostic Trouble Code Catalogue Version 2022",
            "description": "A sample graph asset/offering referring to a specific diagnosis resource.",
            "version": "1.9.3-SNAPSHOT",
            "contenttype": "application/json, application/xml",
            "cx-common:publishedUnderContract": "Contract?oem=Graph",
            "rdf:type": "cx-common:GraphAsset",
            "rdfs:isDefinedBy": "<https://w3id.org/catenax/ontology/diagnosis>",
            "cx-common:implementsProtocol": "cx-common:Protocol?w3c:http:SPARQL",
            "sh:shapesGraph": "@prefix cx-common: <https://w3id.org/catenax/ontology/common#>. \n@prefix : <GraphAsset?oem=Diagnosis2022#> .\n@prefix cx-diag: <https://w3id.org/catenax/ontology/diagnosis#> .\n@prefix owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#> .\n@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .\n@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .\n@prefix sh: <http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#> .\n\n:OemDTC rdf:type sh:NodeShape ;\n  sh:targetClass cx-diag:DTC ;\n  sh:property [\n        sh:path cx-diag:provisionedBy ;\n        sh:hasValue <urn:bpn:legal:BPNL00000003COJN> ;\n    ] ;\n  sh:property [\n        sh:path cx-diag:version ;\n        sh:hasValue \"0\"^^xsd:long \n    ] ;\n  sh:property [\n        sh:path cx-diag:affects ;\n        sh:class :OemDiagnosedParts\n    ] .\n\n:OemDiagnosedParts rdf:type sh:NodeShape ;\n  sh:targetClass cx-diag:DiagnosedPart ;\n  sh:property [\n        sh:path cx-diag:provisionedBy ;\n        sh:hasValue <urn:bpn:legal:BPNL00000003COJN>\n    ] .\n",
            "cx-common:isFederated": "true^^xsd:boolean"
        }
    },
    "dataAddress": {
        "id":"GraphAsset?oem=Diagnosis2022",
        "@type": "DataAddress",
        "baseUrl": "{{oemProviderAgent}}/sparql",
        "type": "cx-common:Protocol?w3c:http:SPARQL",
        "proxyPath": "false",
        "proxyMethod": "true",
        "proxyQueryParams": "true",
        "proxyBody": "true",
        "authKey": "{{oemBackendAuthKey}}",
        "authCode": "{{oemBackendAuthCode}}"
    }
}

            "contenttype": "application/json, application/xml",
            "cx-common:publishedUnderContract": "Contract?supplier=Graph",
            "rdf:type": "cx-common:GraphAsset",

item.name: Consumer (Federating Agent)
EDC (intern)
Setup Assets, Policies, Contracts and Skills
Create Remaining Useful Life Skill Asset

header.warning: This is a duplicate header and will be overridden by the X-Api-Key header generated by Postman.

body.raw:
{
    "asset": {
        "properties": {
            "asset:prop:id": "urn:cx:Skill:consumer:Lifetime",
            "asset:prop:contract": "<urn:cx:Skill:consumer>",
            "asset:prop:name": "Remaining Useful Lifetime Skill for Vehicles",
            "asset:prop:description": "A sample skill asset/offering implemented via SparQL.",
            "asset:prop:version": "0.7.4-SNAPSHOT",
            "asset:prop:contenttype": "application/json, application/xml",
            "cx:protocol": "<urn:cx:Protocol:w3c:Http#SPARQL>",
            "rdf:type": "<{{cxOntologyRoot}}/cx_ontology.ttl#SkillAsset>",
            "rdfs:isDefinedBy": "<{{cxOntologyRoot}}/diagnosis_ontology.ttl>,<{{cxOntologyRoot}}/part_ontology.ttl>,<{{cxOntologyRoot}}/prognosis_ontology.ttl>",
            "cx:isFederated": "true",
            "cx:shape": "PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> 
PREFIX rdf:           <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX rdfs:          <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX cx:            <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/cx.ttl#>
PREFIX cx-diag:       <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/diagnosis.ttl#>
PREFIX cx-telematics: <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/telematics.ttl#>
PREFIX cx-lifetime:   <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/lifetime.ttl#>

##############################################################################################
#                  Catena-X Knowledge Agents Sample Federated Skill                          #
#                         Realizes a 5-Step Business Process                                 #
#            "Remaining Useful Life Prognosis based on Diagnosis TroubleCodes"               #
##############################################################################################
# Preconditions:                                                                             #
# - A Contract Offering from OEM (e.g. BMW) to CONSUMER (e.g. ADAC)                          #
#   - VIN-VAN Conversion                                                                     #
#   - DTC Analysis/Resolution (including the READING of PartType and Description)            #
#   - Serial Part & SUPPLIER Lookup                                                          #
# - A Contract Offering from SUPPLIER (e.g. ZF) to OEM                                       #
#   - Telematics data (including the PROPAGATION of LoadSpectrum)                            #
#   - RUL Prognosis Invocation (including the DISTRIBUTION of RUL results)                   #
##############################################################################################

####
# 5. Project the actual output of the Skill on CONSUMER side
####
SELECT  ?van ?description ?serializedPartName ?distance ?time ?vin ?troubleCode WHERE {

    ####
    # 1. The CONSUMER detects a trouble code on a car in his fleet
    ####
    VALUES (?vin ?troubleCode) { ("@vin"^^xsd:string "@troubleCode"^^xsd:string) }.
    
    ####
    # 2. The CONSUMER looks up the OEM (connector) associated to the VIN 
    #    using the Federated Data Catalogue  (Catalogue=Default Graph)
    ####
    ?oem cx:isIssuerOfVehicleIdentificationNumber ?vin;
         cx:hasConnector ?oemConnector.

    ?oemConnector cx:offersAsset ?diagnoseAsset.
    ?diagnoseAsset rdfs:isDefinedBy "https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/diagnosis_ontology.ttl"^^xsd:string.

    ####
    # 3. The CONSUMER delegates the following logic to the OEM (connector)
    ####
    SERVICE ?oemConnector { 

        ####
        # 3.1 The OEM (e.g. BMW) anomyzes the VIN into an anomymous (VAN) node
        #.    and gets some master data with it 
        ####
        ?van cx:isAnonymousVehicle ?vin;
             cx:hasRegistration ?registration.

        ####
        # 3.2 The OEM analyzes the DTC-affected part type (Diagnosis Graph)
        ####
        GRAPH ?diagnoseAsset {

           ?Dtc rdf:type cx-diag:DTC; 
                cx-diag:Code ?troubleCode;
                cx-diag:affects [ cx-diag:EnDenomination ?partType ]; 
                cx-diag:Description ?description.
        
        } # OEM#Diagnosis context

        ####
        # 3.3 The OEM obtains fresh telematics/load-spectrum data for the vehicle
        #     focussed to the problematic partType (Telematics Graph) 
        ####
        ?van cx-telematics:latestMileageReceived ?mileage;
             cx-telematics:latestDetailReceived ?telematicsDetail.
        ?telematicsDetail cx-diag:hasPartType ?partType;
                          cx-diag:hasLoadSpectrum ?loadSpectrum.

        ####
        # 3.4 The OEM looks up the serialized part of the VAN (Traceability Graph)
        #     and the supplier address in the dataspace
        ####
        ?serializedPart cx:isComponentOf+ ?van;
                        cx:hasPartType ?partType;
                        cx:hasName ?serializedPartName;
                        cx:hasSupplier [
                            cx:hasConnector ?tieraConnector
                        ].           

        ?tieraConnector cx:offersAsset ?prognosisAsset.
        ?prognosisAsset rdfs:isDefinedBy "https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/lifetime.ttl#"^^xsd:string.

        ####
        # 4. The OEM (and not the CONSUMER) delegates to the SUPPLIER (connector)
        #    which means that load spectrum data etc is only exchanged using their
        #    contract and between their connectors.
        ####
        SERVICE ?tieraConnector { 

            ####
            # 4.1 The SUPPLIER adds additional measurement information
            ####
            ?telematicsDetail cx-telematics:hasFile ?loadSpectrumFile;
                              cx-telematics:hasHeader ?loadSpectrumHeader.

            ####
            # 4.2 The SUPPLIER invokes a prognosis model associated the part type using the load-spectrum data
            ####
            GRAPH ?prognosisAsset {

                ?invocation rdf:type cx-lifetime:LifetimePrognosis;
                    
                    # <--General vehicle info
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveMileage ?mileage;
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveRegistrationDate ?registration;

                    # <--Part Info from the OEM
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveComponent ?serializedPartName;
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveBody ?loadSpectrum;
                    
                    # <--Additional info from the SUPPLIER
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveFile ?loadSpectrumFile;
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveHeader ?loadSpectrumHeader; 
                    
                    # -->the actual prognosis output
                    cx-lifetime:remainingDistance ?distance; 
                    cx-lifetime:remainingTime ?time.
            
            } # SUPPLIER#Prognosis context
        
        } # SUPPLIER context

    } # OEM context

   # now we do reporting/operationalising on the CONSUMER side
} ORDER BY ?remainingDistance LIMIT 5"
        }
    },
    "dataAddress": {
        "properties": {
            "asset:prop:id": "urn:cx:Skill:consumer:Lifetime",
            "type": "urn:cx:Protocol:w3c:Http#SKILL#SPARQL",
            "query": "PREFIX xsd:           <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> 
PREFIX rdf:           <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX rdfs:          <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX cx:            <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/cx.ttl#>
PREFIX cx-diag:       <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/diagnosis.ttl#>
PREFIX cx-telematics: <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/telematics.ttl#>
PREFIX cx-lifetime:   <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/lifetime.ttl#>

##############################################################################################
#                  Catena-X Knowledge Agents Sample Federated Skill                          #
#                         Realizes a 5-Step Business Process                                 #
#            "Remaining Useful Life Prognosis based on Diagnosis TroubleCodes"               #
##############################################################################################
# Preconditions:                                                                             #
# - A Contract Offering from OEM (e.g. BMW) to CONSUMER (e.g. ADAC)                          #
#   - VIN-VAN Conversion                                                                     #
#   - DTC Analysis/Resolution (including the READING of PartType and Description)            #
#   - Serial Part & SUPPLIER Lookup                                                          #
# - A Contract Offering from SUPPLIER (e.g. ZF) to OEM                                       #
#   - Telematics data (including the PROPAGATION of LoadSpectrum)                            #
#   - RUL Prognosis Invocation (including the DISTRIBUTION of RUL results)                   #
##############################################################################################

####
# 5. Project the actual output of the Skill on CONSUMER side
####
SELECT  ?van ?description ?serializedPartName ?distance ?time ?vin ?troubleCode WHERE {

    ####
    # 1. The CONSUMER detects a trouble code on a car in his fleet
    ####
    VALUES (?vin ?troubleCode) { ("@vin"^^xsd:string "@troubleCode"^^xsd:string) }.
    
    ####
    # 2. The CONSUMER looks up the OEM (connector) associated to the VIN 
    #    using the Federated Data Catalogue  (Catalogue=Default Graph)
    ####
    ?oem cx:isIssuerOfVehicleIdentificationNumber ?vin;
         cx:hasConnector ?oemConnector.

    ?oemConnector cx:offersAsset ?diagnoseAsset.
    ?diagnoseAsset rdfs:isDefinedBy "https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/diagnosis_ontology.ttl"^^xsd:string.

    ####
    # 3. The CONSUMER delegates the following logic to the OEM (connector)
    ####
    SERVICE ?oemConnector { 

        ####
        # 3.1 The OEM (e.g. BMW) anomyzes the VIN into an anomymous (VAN) node
        #.    and gets some master data with it 
        ####
        ?van cx:isAnonymousVehicle ?vin;
             cx:hasRegistration ?registration.

        ####
        # 3.2 The OEM analyzes the DTC-affected part type (Diagnosis Graph)
        ####
        GRAPH ?diagnoseAsset {

           ?Dtc rdf:type cx-diag:DTC; 
                cx-diag:Code ?troubleCode;
                cx-diag:affects [ cx-diag:EnDenomination ?partType ]; 
                cx-diag:Description ?description.
        
        } # OEM#Diagnosis context

        ####
        # 3.3 The OEM obtains fresh telematics/load-spectrum data for the vehicle
        #     focussed to the problematic partType (Telematics Graph) 
        ####
        ?van cx-telematics:latestMileageReceived ?mileage;
             cx-telematics:latestDetailReceived ?telematicsDetail.
        ?telematicsDetail cx-diag:hasPartType ?partType;
                          cx-diag:hasLoadSpectrum ?loadSpectrum.

        ####
        # 3.4 The OEM looks up the serialized part of the VAN (Traceability Graph)
        #     and the supplier address in the dataspace
        ####
        ?serializedPart cx:isComponentOf+ ?van;
                        cx:hasPartType ?partType;
                        cx:hasName ?serializedPartName;
                        cx:hasSupplier [
                            cx:hasConnector ?tieraConnector
                        ].           

        ?tieraConnector cx:offersAsset ?prognosisAsset.
        ?prognosisAsset rdfs:isDefinedBy "https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/lifetime.ttl#"^^xsd:string.

        ####
        # 4. The OEM (and not the CONSUMER) delegates to the SUPPLIER (connector)
        #    which means that load spectrum data etc is only exchanged using their
        #    contract and between their connectors.
        ####
        SERVICE ?tieraConnector { 

            ####
            # 4.1 The SUPPLIER adds additional measurement information
            ####
            ?telematicsDetail cx-telematics:hasFile ?loadSpectrumFile;
                              cx-telematics:hasHeader ?loadSpectrumHeader.

            ####
            # 4.2 The SUPPLIER invokes a prognosis model associated the part type using the load-spectrum data
            ####
            GRAPH ?prognosisAsset {

                ?invocation rdf:type cx-lifetime:LifetimePrognosis;
                    
                    # <--General vehicle info
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveMileage ?mileage;
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveRegistrationDate ?registration;

                    # <--Part Info from the OEM
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveComponent ?serializedPartName;
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveBody ?loadSpectrum;
                    
                    # <--Additional info from the SUPPLIER
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveFile ?loadSpectrumFile;
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveHeader ?loadSpectrumHeader; 
                    
                    # -->the actual prognosis output
                    cx-lifetime:remainingDistance ?distance; 
                    cx-lifetime:remainingTime ?time.
            
            } # SUPPLIER#Prognosis context
        
        } # SUPPLIER context

    } # OEM context

   # now we do reporting/operationalising on the CONSUMER side
} ORDER BY ?remainingDistance LIMIT 5",
            "proxyPath": "false",
            "proxyMethod": "false",
            "proxyQueryParams": "true",
            "proxyBody": "false"
        }
    }
}

##############################################################################################
#                  Catena-X Knowledge Agents Sample Federated Skill                          #
#                         Realizes a 5-Step Business Process                                 #
#            "Remaining Useful Life Prognosis based on Diagnosis TroubleCodes"               #
##############################################################################################
# Preconditions:                                                                             #
# - A Contract Offering from OEM (e.g. BMW) to CONSUMER (e.g. ADAC)                          #
#   - VIN-VAN Conversion                                                                     #
#   - DTC Analysis/Resolution (including the READING of PartType and Description)            #
#   - Serial Part & SUPPLIER Lookup                                                          #
# - A Contract Offering from SUPPLIER (e.g. ZF) to OEM                                       #
#   - Telematics data (including the PROPAGATION of LoadSpectrum)                            #
#   - RUL Prognosis Invocation (including the DISTRIBUTION of RUL results)                   #
##############################################################################################

####
# 5. Project the actual output of the Skill on CONSUMER side
####
SELECT ?van ?troubleCode ?description ?affectedPart ?distanceKm ?timeDays ?vin WHERE {

    ####
    # 1. The CONSUMER detects a trouble code on a car in his fleet
    ####
    VALUES (?vin ?troubleCode) { ("@vin"^^xsd:string "@troubleCode"^^xsd:string) }.
    
     ####
    # 2. The CONSUMER looks up the OEM (connector) associated to the VIN 
    #    using the Federated Data Catalogue  (Catalogue=Default Graph)
    ####
    ?oem cx:isIssuerOfVehicleIdentificationNumber ?vin;
         cx:hasConnector ?oemConnector.

    ?oemConnector cx:offersAsset ?diagnoseAsset.
    ?diagnoseAsset rdf:type <{{cxOntologyRoot}}/cx_ontology.ttl#GraphAsset>;
                   rdfs:isDefinedBy <{{cxOntologyRoot}}/diagnosis_ontology.ttl>.

    ####
    # 3. The CONSUMER delegates the following logic to the OEM (connector)
    ####
    SERVICE ?oemConnector { 

        ####
        # 3.1 The OEM (e.g. BMW) anomyzes the VIN into an anomymous (VAN) node
        #.    and gets some master data with it 
        ####
        ?van cx:isAnonymousVehicle ?vin;
             cx:hasRegistration ?registration.

        ####
        # 3.2 The OEM analyzes the DTC-affected part type (Diagnosis Graph)
        ####
        GRAPH ?diagnoseAsset {

           ?Dtc rdf:type cx-diag:DTC; 
                cx-diag:Code ?troubleCode;
                cx-diag:affects [ cx-diag:EnDenomination ?partType ]; 
                cx-diag:Description ?description.
        
        } # OEM#Diagnosis context

        ####
        # 3.3 The OEM obtains fresh telematics/load-spectrum data for the vehicle
        #     focussed to the problematic partType (Telematics Graph) 
        ####
        ?van cx-telematics:latestMileageReceived ?mileage;
             cx-telematics:latestDetailReceived ?telematicsDetail.
        ?telematicsDetail cx-diag:hasPartType ?partType;
                          cx-diag:hasLoadSpectrum ?loadSpectrum.

        ####
        # 3.4 The OEM looks up the serialized part of the VAN (Traceability Graph)
        #     and the supplier address in the dataspace
        ####
        ?serializedPart cx:isComponentOf+ ?van;
                        cx:hasPartType ?partType;
                        cx:hasName ?affectedPart;
                        cx:hasSupplier [
                            cx:hasConnector ?tieraConnector
                        ].           

        ?tieraConnector cx:offersAsset ?prognosisAsset.
        ?prognosisAsset rdfs:isDefinedBy <{{cxOntologyRoot}}/prognosis_ontology.ttl>.

        ####
        # 4. The OEM (and not the CONSUMER) delegates to the SUPPLIER (connector)
        #    which means that load spectrum data etc is only exchanged using their
        #    contract and between their connectors.
        ####
        SERVICE ?tieraConnector { 

            ####
            # 4.1 The SUPPLIER adds additional measurement information
            ####
            ?telematicsDetail cx-telematics:hasFile ?loadSpectrumFile;
                              cx-telematics:hasHeader ?loadSpectrumHeader.

            ####
            # 4.2 The SUPPLIER invokes a prognosis model associated the part type using the load-spectrum data
            ####
            GRAPH ?prognosisAsset {

                ?invocation rdf:type cx-lifetime:LifetimePrognosis;
                    
                    # <--General vehicle info
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveMileage ?mileage;
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveRegistrationDate ?registration;

                    # <--Part Info from the OEM
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveComponent ?affectedPart;
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveBody ?loadSpectrum;
                    
                    # <--Additional info from the SUPPLIER
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveFile ?loadSpectrumFile;
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveHeader ?loadSpectrumHeader; 
                    
                    # -->the actual prognosis output
                    cx-lifetime:remainingDistance ?distanceKm; 
                    cx-lifetime:remainingTime ?timeDays.
            
            } # SUPPLIER#Prognosis context
        
        } # SUPPLIER context

    } # OEM context

   # now we do reporting/operationalising on the CONSUMER side
} ORDER BY ?remainingDistance LIMIT 5

##############################################################################################

####
# 5. Project the actual output of the Skill on CONSUMER side
####
SELECT ?van ?troubleCode ?affectedAssembly ?problem ?kmLeft ?daysLeft ?vin WHERE {

    ####
    # 1. The CONSUMER detects a trouble code on a car in his fleet

    VALUES (?vin ?troubleCode) { ("@vin"^^xsd:string "@troubleCode"^^xsd:string) }.
    
     ####

    #    using the Federated Data Catalogue  (Catalogue=Default Graph)

    ?oem cx:isIssuerOfVehicleIdentificationNumber ?vin;
         cx:hasConnector ?oemConnector.

    #?oemConnector cx:offersAsset ?diagnoseAsset.
    #?diagnoseAsset rdf:type <{{cxOntologyRoot}}/cx_ontology.ttl#GraphAsset>;
    #               rdfs:isDefinedBy <{{cxOntologyRoot}}/diagnosis_ontology.ttl>.

        #.    and gets some master data with it

        ?van cx:isAnonymousVehicle ?vin;

        #     focussed to the problematic partType (Telematics Graph) 
        ####
        ?van cx-telematics:latestMileageReceived ?mileage;
             cx-telematics:latestDetailReceived ?telematicsDetail.
        ?telematicsDetail cx-diag:hasPartType ?partType;
                          cx-diag:hasLoadSpectrum ?loadSpectrum.

        ####

        #    which means that load spectrum data etc is only exchanged using their
        #    contract and between their connectors.
        ####
        #SERVICE ?tieraConnector { 

            ####
            # 4.1 The SUPPLIER adds additional measurement information
            ####
            ?telematicsDetail cx-telematics:hasFile ?loadSpectrumFile;
                              cx-telematics:hasHeader ?loadSpectrumHeader.

            ####
            # 4.2 The SUPPLIER invokes a prognosis model associated the part type using the load-spectrum data
            ####
            SERVICE <{{tierARemotingAgent}}/repositories/prognosis> {

                ?invocation rdf:type cx-lifetime:LifetimePrognosis;
                    
                    # <--General vehicle info

                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveRegistrationDate ?registration;

                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveHeader ?loadSpectrumHeader; 
                    
                    # -->the actual prognosis output
                    cx-lifetime:remainingDistance ?kmLeft; 
                    cx-lifetime:remainingTime ?daysLeft.
            
            } # SUPPLIER#Prognosis context
        
        #} # SUPPLIER context

    #} # OEM context

   # now we do reporting/operationalising on the CONSUMER side
} ORDER BY ?remainingDistance LIMIT 5

body.raw:
PREFIX cx: <https://raw.githubusercontent.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/main/ontology/cx_ontology.ttl#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> 

###############################
# Recursive Product Trace Skill
# Input: 
#  currentSite    - IRI to a business site
#  currentProduct - IRI to an affected product (produced by site currentSite)  
#  currentDepth   - integer indicating the start depth 
#  maxDepth       - integer indicating the max depth to search for (counted from startDepth on)
#  binding        - technical variable can always be set to 0
# Output:
#  affectedDepth. - The depth at which an affected end product has been detected
#  affectedSite.  - The site which produces the affected end product 
#  binding        - technical output is equal to input @binding
###############################

SELECT DISTINCT ?binding ?affectedDepth ?affectedSite WHERE {

  # Input parameter binding
  VALUES (?currentSite ?currentProduct ?currentDepth ?maxDepth ?binding) { 
      (<@currentSite> <@currentProduct> "@currentDepth"^^xsd:integer "@maxDepth"^^xsd:integer "@binding")
  }.

  # End recursion below watermark  
  FILTER(?maxDepth >= 0).

  # Lookup the Traceability-As-Planned Graph/Asset of the relevant business partner
  ?incidentOrga cx:hasSite ?currentSite;
                cx:hasConnector ?connectorUrl.

  # Call the TAP GrapH
  SERVICE ?connectorUrl {
      ?currentProduct rdf:type cx:Part.

      # If this is not end product, we find a consuming site/assembly
      OPTIONAL {
          ?currentProduct cx:isPartOf ?assembly.
          ?assembly cx:isProducedBy ?site2.
      }
  }

  # Case disctinction
  {
     # The actual recursive call invokes this skill for all parent assemblies and moves the depth bounds
     FILTER(?maxDepth >= 1).
     FILTER(BOUND(?site2)).
     BIND(?maxDepth-1 AS ?nextDepth).
     BIND(?currentDepth+1 AS ?nextCurrentDepth).

     # Doe the actual recusion binding
     SERVICE <{{consumerAgentPlaneInternal}}/api/agent?asset=urn:cx:Skill:consumer:ProductTrace> {
        BIND(?site2 AS ?currentSite).
        BIND(?nextDepth AS ?maxDepth).
        BIND(?nextCurrentDepth AS ?currentDepth).
        BIND(?assembly AS ?currentProduct).
     }.
   } UNION {
       # The recursion ends at final products with no B2B consumers
       FILTER(!BOUND(?site2)).
       BIND(?currentDepth AS ?affectedDepth).
       BIND(?currentSite AS ?affectedSite).
   }
}

    SERVICE ?oemConnector {
        VALUES(?van) { str(?vin) }.
    }

   # now we do reporting/operationalising on the CONSUMER side
}

Uses the Agent Extension of the Dataplane to Invoke a Stored Skill.

Uses the Agent Extension of the Dataplane to Invoke a Stored Skill using Parameters. Note the tuple syntax for URL parameters using the "(" symbol as the starting character of parameter names to introduce nesting and the ")" symbol as the ending character in parameter values to close a nested layer.

body.raw:
PREFIX xsd:           <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> 
PREFIX rdf:           <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX rdfs:          <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX cx:            <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/cx.ttl#>
PREFIX cx-telematics: <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/telematics.ttl#>
PREFIX cx-lifetime:   <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/lifetime.ttl#>

##############################################################################################
#                  Catena-X Knowledge Agents Sample Federated Skill                          #
#                         Realizes a 5-Step Business Process                                 #
#            "Remaining Useful Life Prognosis based on Diagnosis TroubleCodes"               #
##############################################################################################
# Preconditions:                                                                             #
# - Federated Data Catalogue containing common (dataspace, business parterners, wmi),        #
#     and domain ontologies.                                                                 #
# - A Graph Contract Offering from OEM (e.g. BMW) to CONSUMER (e.g. ADAC)                    #
#   - VIN-VAN Conversion                                                                     #
#   - DTC Analysis/Resolution (including the READING of PartType and Description)            #
#   - Serial Part & SUPPLIER Lookup                                                          #
# - A Graph Contract Offering from SUPPLIER (e.g. ZF) to OEM                                 #
#   - Telematics data (including the PROPAGATION of LoadSpectrum)                            #
#   - RUL Prognosis Invocation (including the DISTRIBUTION of RUL results)                   #
##############################################################################################

####
# 5. Project the actual output of the Skill on CONSUMER side
####
SELECT ?van ?troubleCode ?description ?affectedPart ?distanceKm ?timeDays ?vin WHERE {

    ####
    # 1. The CONSUMER detects a trouble code on a car in his fleet
    ####
    VALUES (?vin ?troubleCode) { ("@vin"^^xsd:string "@troubleCode"^^xsd:string) }.
    
    ####
    # 2. The CONSUMER looks up the OEM (connector) associated to the VIN 
    #    using the Federated Data Catalogue  (Catalogue=Default Graph)
    ####
    ?oem cx:isIssuerOfVehicleIdentificationNumber ?vin;
         cx:hasConnector ?oemConnector.

    ?oemConnector cx:offersAsset ?telematicsAsset.
    ?telematicsAsset rdf:type cx:GraphAsset;
                     rdfs:isDefinedBy cx-telematics:Ontology.

    ####
    # 3. The CONSUMER delegates the following logic to the OEM (connector)
    ####
    SERVICE ?oemConnector { 

        ####
        # 3.1 For each subordinate GRAPH, an asset negotiation between CONSUMER and OEM will occur
        ####
        GRAPH ?telematicsAsset {

           ####
           # 3.1 The OEM (e.g. BMW) anomyzes the VIN into an anomymous (VAN) node
           #     and gets some master data with it 
           ####
           ?van cx:isAnonymousVehicle ?vin;
                cx:hasRegistration ?registration.

           ####
           # 3.2 The OEM analyzes the DTC-affected part type (Diagnosis Graph)
           ####
           ?Dtc rdf:type cx-diag:DTC; 
                cx-telematics:Code ?troubleCode;
                cx-telematics:affects [ cx-diag:EnDenomination ?partType ]; 
                cx-telematics:Description ?description.
        
            ####
            # 3.3 The OEM obtains fresh telematics/load-spectrum data for the vehicle
            #     focussed to the problematic partType (Telematics Graph) 
            ####
            ?van cx-telematics:latestMileageReceived ?mileage;
                 cx-telematics:latestDetailReceived ?telematicsDetail.
            ?telematicsDetail cx-telematics:hasPartType ?partType;
                            cx-telematics:hasLoadSpectrum ?loadSpectrum.

            ####
            # 3.4 The OEM looks up the serialized part of the VAN (Traceability Graph)
            #     and the supplier address in the dataspace
            ####
            ?serializedPart cx:isComponentOf+ ?van;
                            cx:hasPartType ?partType;
                            cx:hasName ?affectedPart;
                            cx:hasSupplier [
                                cx:hasConnector ?tieraConnector
                            ].           
        } # Leave the OEM#Telematics context (back to the Federated Data Catalogue of the OEM)

        ####
        # 3.5 The OEM looks up the connector and contract offers 
        ####
        ?tieraConnector cx:offersAsset ?prognosisAsset.
        ?prognosisAsset rdf:type cx:GraphAsset; rdfs:isDefinedBy cx-lifetime:Ontology.

        ####
        # 4. The OEM (and not the CONSUMER) delegates to the SUPPLIER (connector)
        #    which means that load spectrum data etc is only exchanged using their
        #    contract and between their connectors.
        ####
        SERVICE ?tieraConnector { 
            GRAPH ?prognosisAsset {

                ####
                # 4.1 The SUPPLIER adds additional measurement information
                ####
                ?telematicsDetail cx-telematics:hasFile ?loadSpectrumFile;
                                  cx-telematics:hasHeader ?loadSpectrumHeader.

                ####
                # 4.2 and invokes a prognosis model associated the part type using the load-spectrum data
                ####

                ?invocation rdf:type cx-lifetime:LifetimePrognosis;
                    # <--General vehicle info
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveMileage ?mileage;
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveRegistrationDate ?registration;

                    # <--Part Info from the OEM
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveComponent ?affectedPart;
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveBody ?loadSpectrum;
                    
                    # <--Additional info from the SUPPLIER
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveFile ?loadSpectrumFile;
                    cx-lifetime:loadCollectiveHeader ?loadSpectrumHeader; 
                    
                    # -->the actual prognosis output
                    cx-lifetime:remainingDistance ?distanceKm; 
                    cx-lifetime:remainingTime ?timeDays.
            
            } # SUPPLIER#Prognosis context -> back to FDC of SUPPLIER
        
        } # SUPPLIER context -> back to FDC of OEM

    } # OEM context -> back to FDC of CONSUMER

   # now we do reporting/operationalising on the CONSUMER side
} ORDER BY ?remainingDistance LIMIT 5

Note the tuple syntax for URL parameters using the "(" symbol as the starting character of parameter names to introduce nesting and the ")" symbol as the ending character in parameter values to close a nested layer.

body.raw:
PREFIX xsd:           <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
PREFIX rdf:           <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX rdfs:          <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX cx:            <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/cx.ttl#>
PREFIX cx-diag:       <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/diagnosis.ttl#>

##############################################################################################
#              Catena-X Knowledge Agents Sample Federated Search Skill                       #
#                     Implements Trouble-Code Search based on VINs                           #
##############################################################################################
# Preconditions:                                                                             #
# - A Contract Offering from OEM (e.g. BMW) to CONSUMER (e.g. ADAC)                          #
#   - VIN-VAN Conversion                                                                     #
#   - DTC Analysis/Resolution (including the READING of Version and Description)             #
##############################################################################################

SELECT ?vin ?codeNumber ?description ?version WHERE {

    ####
    # Three parameters to the custom search
    ####
    VALUES (?vin ?problemArea ?minVersion) {("WBAAL31029PZ00001"^^xsd:string "Getriebe"^^xsd:string "1"^^xsd:long)}

    ####
    # Lookup the responsible OEM(s)
    ####
    ?oem cx:isIssuerOfVehicleIdentificationNumber ?vin;
         cx:hasConnector ?oemConnector.
    ?oemConnector cx:offersAsset ?diagnoseAsset.
    ?diagnoseAsset rdf:type <https://raw.githubusercontent.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/main/ontology/cx_ontology.ttl#GraphAsset>;
                   rdfs:isDefinedBy <https://raw.githubusercontent.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/main/ontology/diagnosis_ontology.ttl>.

    ####
    # Delegate to the revelant connector(s) and asset(s)
    ####
    SERVICE ?oemConnector {
        GRAPH ?diagnoseAsset {

            ####
            # the actual subselect carrying the FILTERs
            ####

            ?Dtc rdf:type cx-diag:DTC;
                 cx-diag:Code ?codeNumber;
                 cx-diag:Description ?description;
                 cx-diag:Version ?version.

            FILTER ( CONTAINS(?description, ?problemArea) && ?version >= ?minVersion)
       
        } # Graph Asset
    } # Remote Connector
} # Search

body.raw:
{
  "asset": {
    "properties": {
      "asset:prop:id": "urn:cx:Skill:consumer:LifetimeGearbox",
      "asset:prop:name": "Remaining Useful Lifetime Skill for Vehicles",
      "asset:prop:description": "A sample skill asset/offering implemented via SparQL.",
      "asset:prop:version": "0.5.5-SNAPSHOT",
      "asset:prop:contenttype": "application/json, application/xml",
      "cx:protocol": "urn:cx:Protocol:w3c:Http#SPARQL",
      "rdf:type":"https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/common_ontology.ttl#SkillAsset",
      "rdfs:isDefinedBy": "https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/cx.ttl",
      "cx:isFederated": true
    }
  },
  "dataAddress": {
    "properties": {
      "asset:prop:id": "urn:cx:Skill:consumer:LifetimeGearbox",
      "type": "urn:cx:Protocol:w3c:Http#SKILL#SPARQL",
      "query": "PREFIX cx: <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/cx.ttl#>
PREFIX cx-diag: <https://github.com/catenax-ng/product-knowledge/ontology/diagnosis.ttl#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
SELECT ?reason ?code ?description ?version ?partend ?partcat ?partclass WHERE {
  # Select Business Partner
  ?Oem cx:BPNL "BPNL00000003COJN".

  # Search for Trouble Codes of the Business Partner
  # related to a cause in the "Kabelbaum"
  ?Dtc rdf:type cx-diag:DTC.
  ?Dtc cx:provisionedBy ?Oem.
  ?Dtc cx-diag:PossibleCauses ?reason.
  FILTER contains(?reason,"Kabelbaum").
  ?Dtc cx-diag:Code ?code.
  ?Dtc cx-diag:Description ?description.
  ?Dtc cx-diag:Version ?version.

  # Navigate to the affected parts
  # and show only parts with a classification "Powertrain"
  ?Dtc cx-diag:affects ?Part.
  ?Part cx-diag:Category ?partcat.
  ?Part cx-diag:EnDenomination ?partend.
  ?Part cx-diag:Classification ?partclass.
  FILTER contains(?partclass,'Powertrain').

}
",
      "proxyPath": "false",
      "proxyMethod": "false",
      "proxyQueryParams": "true",
      "proxyBody": "false"
    }
  }
}
